intro: Gonystylus stenosepalus, commonly known as the narrow-sepal ironwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood and small, elliptical leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
